com.facebook.buck.rules.coercer

Interface TypeCoercer<T>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - resulting type
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AppleSourceTypeCoercer, BuildRuleTypeCoercer, BuildTargetTypeCoercer, CollectionTypeCoercer, EitherTypeCoercer, EnumTypeCoercer, IdentityTypeCoercer, LabelTypeCoercer, LeafTypeCoercer, ListTypeCoercer, MapTypeCoercer, NumberTypeCoercer, PairTypeCoercer, PathTypeCoercer, SetTypeCoercer, SortedSetTypeCoercer, SourcePathTypeCoercer

    public interface TypeCoercer<T>
    Class defining an interpretation of some dynamically typed Java object as a specific class. Used to coerce JSON parser output from BUCK files into the proper type to populate Description rule args.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes

    • Method Detail

      • getOutputClass

        Class<T> getOutputClass()

      • hasElementClass

        boolean hasElementClass(Class<?>... types)
        Returns whether the leaf nodes of this type coercer outputs value that is an instance of the given class or its subclasses. Does not match non-leaf nodes like Map or List.

      • traverse

        boolean traverse(Object object,
               TypeCoercer.Traversal traversal)
        Traverse an object guided by this TypeCoercer. #{link Traversal#traverse} function will be called once for the object. If the object is a collection or map, it will also recursively traverse all elements of the map. Note that this does not check that the input can be coerced, except with respect to traversal. That is, it will check that the object is a collection before traversing down its members, but will not check that it's indeed a BuildTarget.
        Returns:
        Whether the traversal succeeded.

      • coerce

        T coerce(BuildRuleResolver buildRuleResolver,
       ProjectFilesystem filesystem,
       Path pathRelativeToProjectRoot,
       Object object)
         throws CoerceFailedException
        Throws:
        CoerceFailedException - Input object cannot be coerced into the given type.

      • getOptionalValue

        Optional<T> getOptionalValue()
        Get a value suitable for an Optional field. This will typically be Optional.absent(), but may be some other value, such as an empty collection.
        Returns:
        A value suitable for fields of type Optional when no value has been set.
